actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on April 24, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Green, Al (TX) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Mrs. Kim (CA) asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Thursday, April 20, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 11:00 a.m. on Monday, April 24, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 219
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 204

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Balint moved to recommit to the Committee on Education and the Workforce.
The House adopted the amendment in the nature of a substitute as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 734.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Mace amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 216

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on the question on agreeing to the Mace amendment to H.R. 734, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 734 — "To amend the Education Amendments of 1972 to provide that for purposes of determining compliance with title IX of such Act in athletics, sex shall be recognized based solely on a person's reproductive biology and genetics at birth."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 734 as unfinished business.
On motion that the Committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Ogles moved that the Committee rise.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 298, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 2.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 2 printed in House Report 118-37 to clarify that the term "athletic programs and activities" includes any activities a recipient chooses to restrict only to members of a team.

At the conclusion of debate on the Mace amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Mace demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 298, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Mace amendment No. 1.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Mace,  numbered 1 printed in House Report 118-37 to require the Comptroller General carry out a study to determine the meaning of the phrase 'any other benefit' as used in subsection (d)(3) by looking at the adverse psychological, developmental, participatory, and sociological results to girls of allowing males to compete, be members of a sports team, or participants in athletic programs, that are designed for girls, including hostile environment creation, sexual assault, and sexual harassment.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 734 — "To amend the Education Amendments of 1972 to provide that for purposes of determining compliance with title IX of such Act in athletics, sex shall be recognized based solely on a person's reproductive biology and genetics at birth."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Ogles to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Flood to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
